sen.j: 五十鈴依媛命（いすずよりひめのみこと 生没年不詳）は、『日本書紀』、『旧事本紀』によれば、綏靖天皇の皇后で、事代主神の娘（母の名は不詳）、安寧天皇の母、五十鈴依姫。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Kujihoongi" (Ancient Japanese History), Isuzuhime no mikoto, also called Isuzuyorihime (date of birth and death unknown) was a wife of Emperor Suizei, a daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami (her mother's name is unknown) and a mother of Emperor Annei.

According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Kujihoongi" (Ancient Japanese History), Isuzuhime no mikoto, also called Isuzuyorihime (date of birth and death unknown) was a wife of Emperor Suizei, a daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami (her mother's name is unknown) and a mother of Emperor Annei.

According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) and "Kujihoongi" (Ancient Japanese History), Isuzuhime no mikoto, also called Isuzuyorihime (date of birth and death unknown) was a wife of Emperor Suizei, a daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami (her mother's name is unknown) and a mother of Emperor Annei.

sen.j: 姉の姫踏鞴五十鈴媛命は神武天皇の皇后となる。
sen.e: Her older sister, Himetatara Isuzuhimenomikoto, became a wife of Emperor Jinmu.
Her older sister, Himetatara Isuzuhimenomikoto, became a wife of Emperor Jimmu.
Her older sister, Himetatara Isuzuhimenomikoto, became a wife of Emperor Jinmu.

sen.j: 欠史八代であるため夫綏靖天皇とともに実在しないとの説がある。
sen.e: As she was one of Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), there is a theory that she was nonexistent, same as her husband Emperor Suizei.
As she was one of Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), there is a theory that she was nonexistent, same as her husband Emperor Suizei.
As she was one of Kesshi-Hachidai (Eight Undocumented Sovereigns), there is a theory that she was nonexistent, same as her husband Emperor Suizei.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の安寧紀によると、五十鈴依媛命は事代主神の少女（おとむすめ）とある。
sen.e: According to Annei-ki of "Nihonshoki", there is a description that Isuzuyorihime no mikoto was a beloved daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to Annei-ki in Nihonshoki, there is a description that Isuzuyorihime no mikoto was a beloved daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami.
According to Annei-ki in Nihonshoki, there is a description that Isuzuyorihime no mikoto was a beloved daughter of Kotoshironushi-no-kami.

sen.j: これは綏靖紀二年条に「（安寧天皇の父である綏靖天皇は）五十鈴依媛を立てて皇后と為したまう。すなわち天皇の姨（みおば）なり」とあるのと合致する。
sen.e: This matched the description from Suizei-ki 二年条 "(Emperor Suizei, a father of Emperor Annei) took Isuzuyori hime for his wife as Empress, that is, she was a mioba (a sister of wife) of Emperor."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 二年条は読み方不明 姨は、五十鈴依媛命の姉も皇后なので、そのことを言っていると思われます。
sen.e: This matched the description in Suizei-ki 二年条 "(Emperor Suizei, a father of Emperor Annei) took Isuzuyori hime for his wife as Empress, that is, she was a mioba (a sister of the wife) of Emperor."
sen.cmt: fromを in に、a sister of wife をa sister of the wifeに変更。
sen.e: This matched the description in Suizei-ki 二年条 "(Emperor Suizei, a father of Emperor Annei) took Isuzuyori hime for his wife as Empress, that is, she was a mioba (a sister of the wife) of Emperor."

sen.j: なお、『古事記』には五十鈴依媛命は登場せず河俣毘売が綏靖天皇皇后。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Isuzuyorihime no mikoto doesn't appear, but Kawamatabime appeared as a wife of Emperor Suizei.
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Isuzuyorihime no mikoto does not appear, but Kawamatabime appears as a wife of Emperor Suizei.
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Isuzuyorihime no mikoto does not appear, but Kawamatabime appears as a wife of Emperor Suizei.
